dimensions.label: Repository Name Clarity
dimensions.description: How clearly the repository name communicates what the project is and, when appropriate, the primary technology or platform.
signals: Use of clear separators (e.g., hyphens) instead of ambiguous casing
Avoidance of internal-only or jokey names

bands.label: Unclear
bands.description: Name is cryptic, overly cute, or provides no hint of purpose or tech stack.

bands.label: Partial
bands.description: Name gives some signal but may be missing key context like platform or tech.

bands.label: Clear
bands.description: Name is literal, searchable, and aligned with how users would describe the project.

dimensions.label: Description Quality
dimensions.description: How well the short description communicates what the project does, who it is for, and on which platform or ecosystem it operates.
signals: Character length within an acceptable range
Mention of target audience and/or platform

bands.label: Missing or Vague
bands.description: No description set, or description is too generic to be useful.

bands.label: Basic
bands.description: Description exists but lacks either clear value proposition, audience, or platform context.

bands.label: Strong
bands.description: Description clearly states what the project does, who it is for, and where it fits.

dimensions.label: Topic Coverage
dimensions.description: How well the repository uses GitHub topics to communicate technology, use case, and domain.
signals: Presence of technology, platform, and use-case topics
Avoidance of redundant or low-signal topics

bands.label: Sparse
bands.description: No topics or only 1â€“2 generic topics.

bands.label: Moderate
bands.description: Some useful topics set, but missing important technology or use-case markers.

bands.label: Comprehensive
bands.description: Topics clearly capture tech stack, platform, and primary use cases without redundancy.

dimensions.label: README Presence & Structure
dimensions.description: Whether a README exists and how well it follows clear, skimmable structure that answers WHAT, WHO, and HOW.
signals: First paragraph covers WHAT + WHO + PLATFORM
Presence of key sections (Installation, Usage, Configuration, Contributing, License)

bands.label: Missing or Minimal
bands.description: No README or a very short README that does not help a new visitor.

bands.label: Basic
bands.description: README exists and covers basics but is missing important sections or structure.

bands.label: Well-Structured
bands.description: README clearly explains what the project is, who it is for, and how to use it, with logical sections.

dimensions.label: Activity Recency
dimensions.description: How recently the repository has seen activity, used only as a weak signal of whether the project appears abandoned.

bands.label: Stale
bands.description: No visible activity for a long period; may appear abandoned without explicit archival messaging.

bands.label: Aging
bands.description: Somewhat old, but not clearly abandoned.

bands.label: Recently Active
bands.description: Recent commits or releases indicate current maintenance.

dimensions.label: Metadata Hygiene
dimensions.description: Overall cleanliness and completeness of repository metadata beyond name/description/topics.
signals: Presence of issue templates or PR templates
Archived flag used appropriately for inactive projects

bands.label: Messy
bands.description: Key metadata is missing or inconsistent; project looks unfinished or unmaintained.

bands.label: Okay
bands.description: Most essentials are present, but some important metadata is missing.

bands.label: Clean
bands.description: Metadata is complete, consistent, and aligned with project status.
